formalText: He doesn't know what's going on this week. There's something that he's been really noticing and something he's had all along that he hasn't really addressed.
He thinks it's important because it really bothers him, but  it hasn't been non-stop all week.
But he's been feeling like super aggravated and melancholy.
That's not a good combination.
Like today,
he's super fucking annoyed about every little thing.
He just doesn't like that.
He just feels aggravated.
It's bothering him.
That's what he was thinking of, and it's that feeling that somehow people are doing something on purpose to him.
Then he doesn't like the flip side which is that he's been feeling just really lethargic like kind of melancholy or something like that.
He's just kind of sluggish and tired and just blah.
Like he feels like he's kind of out of it or tired.
He doesn't like getting so worked up about these things.
These moments are just intense and he's giving himself a headache.
It's like his head hurts.
So he was moving and then his mom showed up with his grandmother and annoyed him.
Like of course, he can't just be in peace this fucking moment.
That just annoyed him.
He just felt really annoyed really annoyed, then to just get a cup of coffee.
At Dunkin Donuts, it's just when it's so fucking claustrophobic in the parking lot.
Then he walks in there and there's a fucking half-ass line and just like, there's something about it.
It's claustrophobic in terms of like this fantasy that somehow they're encroaching on his space.
They're not, and he knows that no one is doing anything on purpose, but it's more how he's reacting to it.
Yeah, because it's a little too much, like every little thing sets him off.
It really makes him super angry.
He feels this way that shit's going to happen all day.
There's going to be some little tick.
It's like he's being poked and prodded like he was bothered today with people driving shitty and too many people.
There's going to be shit and there's going to be weird noises of people like in his space.
In the past he's very sensitive to noise.
Then he thinks what happens is
that it trickles or turns into self-defeating thoughts.
It's what happens on days like this when it's this bad cuz he's paralyzed for the day.
He can't do anything.
He can't think straight.
Can't really enjoy anything.
It's very difficult.
He was like, fuck himself and fuck these people.
It's just fucking annoying.
He's kind of sad and mostly aggravated.
